article.title: Raytheon Receives $76 Million for Dismount Detection Radar
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Raytheon Company, El Segundo, California, is being awarded a $76,619,379 cost-plus-incentive-fee, cost reimbursement contract for the dismount detection radar (DDR) effort will provide for the development, design, build, test, integration, certification, and delivery of four DDR systems.Â Electronic Systems Center, Hanscom Air Force Base, Massachusetts, is the contracting activity.
